value.title: 3 ways to REDUCE DATA In Power BI Desktop (No Premium needed!)
value.excerpt: Sometimes you want to reduce data in Power BI Desktop so it's easier to work with. Then work with all the data in the Power BI Service. Patrick shows you 3 ways that can help do this without using Incremental Refresh or needing Power BI Premium!  ðŸ“¢ Become a member: https://guyinacu.be/membership

value.title: 9 things to know before getting into Power BI (Or, really anything)
value.excerpt: We share 9 things to know before starting your journey with Power BI. Really this applies to anything...   Power BI User Groups: https://www.pbiusergroup.com/  *** Social Media Resources *** Power BI Community: https://community.powerbi.com Twitter: https://twitter.com/search?q=%23powerbi&src=typed_query

value.title: A quick look at the new Power BI Report Builder
value.excerpt: Patrick takes a quick look at Power BI Report Builder including how to get it. This report builder is optimized for the Power BI service. Patrick calls out a few reasons this is the case.  Power BI Paginated Report Builder Now Available https://powerbi.microsoft.com/en-us/blog/power-bi-paginated-report-builder-now-available/

value.title: Analyze days from two months on one line chart in Power BI

value.title: Are you following best practices with Azure Synapse Analytics?

value.title: Best Practice Analyzer in Tabular Editor for your Power BI Dataset
value.excerpt: Do you work on your Power BI dataset or data model? Are you following best practices? Patrick walks you through a best practice analyzer set for Tabular Editor, from Michael Kolvasky, that can help you improve your data model. value.title: Case of the Broken Power BI Incremental Refresh
value.excerpt: Are you using Power BI incremental refresh? Have you had it not work even though you set everything up? In this video, Patrick looks at a scenario where Power BI incremental refresh was broken. He then looks at a way to get Power BI incremental refresh working properly.  LET'S CONNECT!  Guy in a Cube

value.title: Convert CSV to Parquet using pySpark in Azure Synapse Analytics
value.excerpt: You've got a bunch of CSV files and you've heard of Parquet. How do you convert them for Azure Synapse Analytics? Patrick shows you how using pySpark.  pyspark DataFrame https://spark.apache.org/docs/latest/api/python/reference/pyspark.sql/dataframe.html  pyspark.sql.DataFrameReader.load https://spark.apache.org/docs/latest/api/python/reference/pyspark.sql/api/pyspark.sql.DataFrameReader.load.html

value.title: Debug DAX using Variables in Power BI

value.title: Demystifying Custom Partitions in Power BI

Patrick takes the mystery away and walks you through how you can create them.  Partitions in tabular models https://docs.microsoft.com/analysis-services/tabular-models/partitions-ssas-tabular

value.title: Excel and OneDrive with Power BI For Collaboration
value.excerpt: In this 2 minute Tuesday, Patrick looks at how to use Excel and OneDrive with Power BI For Collaboration. Using this approach, you can easily keep Power BI updated when team members update an Excel spreadsheet hosted on OneDrive. This is a great alternative to using Google Sheets which can be painful
